thread.title: Airline Travel: Two Legs Good, Four Legs Bad

author: wsjcom
title: Airline Travel: Two Legs Good, Four Legs Bad
text: Having shared a three-seat row with a couple and their medium-size dog on a 6.5-hour cross-country flight, I cannot agree more with “The Middle Seat: On Your Next Trip, Leave the Pets at Home” (Life & Arts, March 21). The dog I shared the row with wasn’t a lap dog and didn’t have any visible indication that it was a service dog. The dog appeared to be sedated although it did get somewhat animated when its owners moved around the cabin and when snacks were distributed. I support the concept of working service dogs traveling with their owners anywhere they reasonably need to be. Those of us who aren’t dog people are...
